race.name: *Postponed to 2025* DQ Hammonton Sprint Triathlon, Duathlon, & Aquabike *#
race.description:
PACKET PICKUP / REGISTRATION INSTRUCTIONS

Registration is digital. There are no paper applications nor is cash accepted. Everyone must sign up online. Online registration closes at the start of the race. Please have the following items easily accesible to maintain the efficiency and speed of Packet Pickup:

  • Required: Proof of ID 
  • Required for Annual Members Only: USAT Membership ID 
  • Optional: Email Confirmation Bar Code per registrant (Printed or Digital) to scan 

WHERE AND WHEN

All events start and finish at Hammonton Lake Park, Hammonton NJ. Parking is available at Kathedral Event Center 499 S Egg Harbor Rd, Hammonton, NJ 08037 and at Universal Supply Co. 582 S Egg Harbor Rd, Hammonton, NJ 08037. IF YOU PARK AT KATHEDRAL, PLEASE DO NOT PARK IN THE BACK OFF CHESTNUT STREET.

RACE SERIES 2023 - Pending Potential Updates

This event is part of the DQ Events Grand Prix and DQ Events Club Challenge.
You are scored for an overall placement, an age group placement, and for finishing the event. At the end of the series there will be prizes for free entries into 2024 and more! Kayak and Non-Multisport events do not gain points.
To be scored in the Grand Prix all you have to do is place in the Overall, Age Group, or finish the race!
To be scored in the Club Challenge you need to select your club during registration and then place in Overall, Age Group, or finish the race!
Please click the links above to learn more.

SWAG

Custom T-Shirts
Custom Finishers Medal

ITINERARY

Sunday

6:15 am - 7:15 am - Check-in, Packet Pickup, and Race-Day Registration online only if available (prices increased)
7:30 am - Pre-race briefing at Transition Area, after the briefing we will require ALL SWIMMERS to cross over the Swim timing mat before we can start the race
7:45 am - Races start (waves based on # of entrants)

DISTANCES

The swim is in a fresh water lake. The bike will be contested on roads though scenic farmland. The run will go around the baseball fields and on local roads. The course is flat and fast. 

Triathlon Distances

1/4 mile Swim , 12 mile Bike, & 3 mile Run

Duathlon Distances

2 mile Run, 12 mile Bike, & 3 mile Run

Aquabike Distances

1/4 mile Swim & 12 mile Bike

AWARDS

No double-dipping or duplicate awards, awards may vary based on event, category, attendance, etc.

Triathlon Awards & Divisions

Overall: Top 3 Male & Female Overall Individuals

Age Group*: Top 3 Male & Female Individuals in the Age Group Division
14 & Under, 15-19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59 60-64, 65-69, 70-74, 75 & Over

Clydesdale* & Athena*: Top 3 Male(220+ lbs) & Female(165+ lbs) Individuals in the Clydesdale/Athena Division

PC/ID Open*: Top 1 Male & Female Individual in the Physically Challenged/Intellectual Disability Open Division
* You can either compete in the Age Group, Clydesdale/Athena, or PC/ID Open division.

Overall Non-Binary: Top 1 Non-Binary Overall Individual

Relay Teams: Top 1 Male, Female, & Co-Ed Team

Duathlon Awards & Divisions

Overall: Top 3 Male & Female Overall Individuals

Age Group*: Top 3 Male & Female Individuals in the Age Group Division
14 & Under, 15-19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59 60-64, 65-69, 70-74, 75 & Over

Clydesdale* & Athena*: Top 3 Male(220+ lbs) & Female(165+ lbs) Individuals in the Clydesdale/Athena Division

PC/ID Open*: Top 1 Male & Female Individual in the Physically Challenged/Intellectual Disability Open Division
* You can either compete in the Age Group, Clydesdale/Athena, or PC/ID Open division.

Overall Non-Binary: Top 1 Non-Binary Overall Individual

Relay Teams: Top 1 Male, Female, & Co-Ed Team

Aquabike Awards

Overall: Top 5 Male & Female Overall Individual

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

  • Refreshments will be provided at the end of the race
  • Split results will be available on website on race day
  • Race scored by DQ Events
  • Event promoters have the right to alter or cancel events for any reason
  • All races will be held rain or shine under guidance of local safety protocol
  • Absolutely no refunds
  • Transfers and Deferrals are only allowed through Runsignup as specified, no exceptions

USAT INFORMATION

This is a USAT Sanctioned event. All participants must have an active USAT Membership that has not expired before the conclusion of the event and must follow all USAT rules and guidelines.

Membership Types (click for more information)
  • Bronze: One Day Membership
  • Silver: Annual Membership w/ Benefits
  • Gold: Annual Membership w/ Expanded Benefits
  • Platinum: Annual Membership w/ Premium Benefits
Common Rules and Information
  • ALL athletes are required to show photo ID. NO ID, NO RACE, NO EXCEPTIONS!
  • Youth (17 and under) athletes without an ID must be accompanied by a parent/guardian with a photo ID
  • Annual members are required to bring their membership card every time they compete in a USAT Sanctioned event.
  • You can download and print out a temporary membership card: https://membership.usatriathlon.org/Member/ViewMemberCard
  • Athletes may only pick up their own packets. Under no circumstances may an athlete pick up a packet for another person.
  • No drafting: a maximum of 15 seconds will be allowed to complete a pass through the draft zone of another athlete
  • Headphones are prohibited
  • No riding in transition at any time
  • Helmets/Chin straps must be worn securely fastened at all times while in possession of your bike. This means before, during, and after the event. This also means from the time you remove your bike from the rack at the start of the bike leg, until after you have placed your bike on the rack at the finish of the bike leg.
  • Verbal or physical abuse of others is not acceptable or tolerated. Participants shall refrain from unsportsmanlike conduct at all times while at the event and during competition, including the use of abusive language; violent acts; intentional misconduct; or any intimidating behavior directed toward, including but not limited to participants, officials, event staff, volunteers and spectators.

race.name: 1 Mile Randall Carter Family Fun Walk
race.description: Lets all get together as one and go out for a healthy walk around our surrounding neighborhood.  Join us for this 1 Mile Family Fun Walk on Saturday April 20th, 2024.  Bring the Strollers, bring the dogs. Let's start spring off in a Healthy Way! Stay afterwards for some fun activities that we have planned!

race.name: 100 Laps of Healing
race.description:
Join us on Sunday, May 5th, 2024 as Dan Wolen will be running 105 laps (26.2 miles) on the HHS Track and our entire community is invited to come out and join him.

Be a part of the message of love and support to those in our community facing a medical crisis by logging a few laps around the track. We invite your entire family, all fitness levels, young and old, to come out and be a part of this event. Consider surprising us with your inner wild by wearing something crazy fun! It is Cinco de Mayo after all! 

Lanes 1-3: Reserved for Runners
Lanes 4-6: Reserved for Walkers (no strollers, no dogs unless medically needed)

Register online (It's free but donations are welcome)
Arrive at the track anytime between 7 AM and 11:00. 
Receive a bib that will count your laps for you. (NEW IN 2024)
Start walking or running!

We finally broke a 7-year record in 2023 and completed 5,754 laps or 1438.5 miles. Do we dare set a goal of 6,000 laps in 2024? 

2024 will mark the 10th annual 100 Laps of Healing event. 

* No strollers and no dogs! (unless medically necessary)

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

  • Encourage friends to donate to your effort. (Flat donations and per lap pledges accepted)
  • Be an event sponsor to bring your own tent, table and signage to put track side.
  • Make a general donation to Dan just because he’s awesome and running 100 Laps of Healing on the track.
  • Start a fundraising page to raise funds for Steps Together with your own laps!
  • Volunteer
  • Donate food, baked goods or water for our participants.

race.name: 10th Annual Sea Isle City STOMPS Cancer 5k & Family Walk and Virtual 5K & Family Walk
race.description:
We look forward to providing a fun and safe race day experience at the 10th Annual Sea Isle City STOMPS Cancer 5K & Family Walk and Virtual 5K & Family Walk starting on June 29, 2024. We had a wonderful event last year! We are keeping the virtual option of this race as we continue to have a lot of interest/participation. The in-person event is on Saturday, June 29th (Registration this year at Excursion Park - right by where the race starts!) and the virtual event will be open for a week from June 22nd-29th. You can participate in the virtual event at any location that is convenient and safe for you! 

                                                                                                            WEEKEND LINE-UP

                                       Friday, June 28- Pre-Packet Pick-Up at Casino Pizza (Corner of 42nd and Park) from 5-7pm

                                       Saturday, June 29- Packet Pick-Up is at Excursion Park (JFK & Promenade) this year starting at 7:30am

                                                                         5K starts at 9:00am

                                                                         Walk starts at 9:15am

This family-fun event will raise funds to provide Unexpected Amazingness to local Families with cancer. Our goal is to keep everyone active and safe while still celebrating all of our amazing Families! Take this opportunity to get outside and take a run/walk with your friends & family.

Please visit www.bringinghopehome.org to learn more about our organization and upcoming events!

Photography Waiver and Audio/Video Recording Policy
By attending the SIC STOMP, you grant us the right to use your name, photograph, and/or video in educational, news, or promotional material, whether in print, electronic, or other media including our website and/or social media.

Covid 19 UPDATE: The race-organizing team is monitoring the local, state, federal, and CDC guidance as it relates to the global pandemic. We prioritize the health of our community, above all else. Details regarding current social distancing measures will be communicated closer to the race.

race.name: 11th Annual Brigantine Open Water Swim
race.description:
Green Whales, Inc. and Greenheads Swimming, along with the Brigantine Beach Patrol, bring you the 11th Annual Brigantine Open Water Swim for ages 7 and over. This year's events are:

  • 400M: Ages 7 - 14
  • 2K: Ages 11 & Over
  • 5K: Ages 12 & Over

This is an open water swim; the current and wave conditions are unpredictable.  Please use good judgment if you are uncertain about swimming in rough water.

The course is set; however, the race committee reserves the right to change the direction of each event due to water conditions. The details of each event with landmarks are provided in the race map(s). Any questions about the course will be addressed at the pre-race meeting by the Race Referee.

race.name: 11th Annual Greta's Run for Imagine
race.description:
Imagine is a growing and evolving organization, that began in Westfield, NJ, and serves families from over 57 towns in NJ. Imagine provides free, year-round grief support for children and families coping with loss due to death. In addition to providing grief support at its two centers in Mountainside and Newark, Imagine provides grief education and training to schools, agencies, and workplaces, and on-site support after any traumatic loss. 

One of the largest 5k’s in the area, Greta’s Run was founded in memory of Greta Schoenemann by her childhood friends Ben Nanna and Jayne Ruotolo. Greta was a Westfield High School freshman when she died from injuries sustained when a tree branch fell on her and her classmates during lunch. This year is the 11-year Anniversary of when the memorial race began.

After the 5K race and Kids Fun Run, we will hold a Memory Walk and invite everyone in our community to participate. You can purchase a lawn sign in honor of a person in your life who has died. We will line the perimeter of this walk and the end of the run with the lawn signs of remembrance, sending a message that although our people have died, they are not forgotten – they are still with us.   

We hope that you will join us and walk alongside our families, our children, and our community, and let everyone know that their loss matters, that they are not alone, and they are never forgotten.    

Pick up your bib and shirt ahead of May 19 Feet Fleet in Westfield - available days and times will be announced closer to the race day. Fleet Feet is located at 123 Quimby St, Westfield, NJ 07090. Can't make it during those times? No worries! Shirts and bibs will also be available for pickup on the morning of the race.

race.name: 15th Annual Chimney Rock 5-ish Miles Trail Race - Presented by Raritan Valley Road Runners
race.description:
Check in Starts at 8:00 am

Race starts at 9:00am

Course Info: Don’t be fooled by the relatively short distance of this race.  This great 5 Miler manages to pack in all forms of trail running to test even the most seasoned trail junkies.  On the single track course (map) you will encounter rocks, gnarly roots, rolling hills, stream crossings, a few climbs, and some speedy (scary) rocky downhill descents!  Course marshals will be stationed throughout the race, in addition to the well-marked trail, to provide assistance and direction.  A water stop will also be available, and you will pass there twice at Miles 1.5 and 4.

Race Day:  Participants can park at Chimney Rock Park parking lot off Chimney Rock Road, with the registration area at the end of the lot near the park bathrooms.  Be sure to check in and collect your bib,  start/finish area, which is a short walk down the paved pathway toward the playground.   

***The pre-race briefing will occur via E-Mail.  A short race announcement will be held prior to the race start****

Awards: Awards for this year's event are sponsored by our generous friends at the Chimney Rock Inn!  Top 3 Male & Female Finishers.  Awards are also given for the top 3 Male & Female finishers in 10 year age bands.  10-19; 20-19; 30-39; 40-49; 50-59; 60-69; 70-79; 80 and over.

Pricing:

Before February 9             RVRR Members - $27       Non-RVRR - $30

February 10 - February 24         RVRR Members - $32       Non-RVRR - $35

February 25 - March 15        RVRR Members - $37        Non-RVRR - $40

Day of Registration: RVRR Members $42             Non-RVRR - $45

Refreshments & Post-Race Party: PIZZA Party at Chimney Rock Inn.  Unlimited Pizza, Salad, and Soft Drinks until 12:30pm

JOIN RVRR: Raritan Valley Road Runners has been New Jersey's Best Running Club since 1983!  We host multiple group runs each week, organize local races throughout the year, and help to promote the sport that we all love in as many ways as possible.  We run hard and play hard, and we would love to have you join us!  Check out our club page at www.rvrr.org and stop by for one of our weekly club runs on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, or Saturday!

race.name: 2023 Virtual 5K Run for Fundacion Caimito City
race.description: Join Fundacion Caimito City in our Virtual 5K Event! As a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering underprivileged families and children in El Caimito, Dominican Republic, we are committed to providing essential food assistance and educational opportunities. By taking part in this virtual event, you have the power to create a lasting positive impact on the lives of those in need. race.name: 2024 AmeriHealth April Fools Half Marathon & 8K
race.description: Run New Jersey's oceanfront half marathon.  With over 8 miles of Boardwalk running, the April Fools Half Marathon offers a shared start and finish line and fast, flat course along the Atlantic Ocean.  If your looking for a spring half marathon, look no further!

race.name: 2024 AmeriHealth Atlantic City Marathon, Half Marathon, 10K & 5K
race.description:
Established in 1958, the Atlantic City Marathon is the third oldest continuing marathon in the United States. 

Taking runners on a tour of Absecon Island, the Atlantic City Marathon & Half Marathon cover ground in the cities of Atlantic City, Ventnor, Margate and Longport. From Boardwalk Casinos to the Marina District and sleepy beach towns, the course offers something for every runner.

Choose from the Marathon, Half Marathon, 10K or 5K.

race.name: 2024 Avon 5K Run/Walk
race.description:
Join us for a seaside race on a flat, partially shaded course through scenic Avon-by-the-Sea. Clocks and water stops at each mile. Shirts guaranteed to first 1,200 registered runners. All runners automatically entered in post-race raffle.  Raffle prizes include season beach badges to the Avon-by-the-Sea beach.  All proceeds benefit the Avon Volunteer First Aid Squad.

The Avon Volunteer First Aid Squad is a not-for-profit, 501c(3) organization that provides emergency medical and rescue services 24 hours a day, seven days a week, at no charge, to residents and visitors to Avon-by-the-Sea. It has provided these services since 1931. The squad is staffed by volunteer EMTs and relies entirely on charitable contributions for all operating expenses.

Registration will close at 1,500 runners. No additional registrations will be accepted after that. 

New schedule for Bib and Shirt Pick-up:

Early Number & Shirt Pickup (at Avon First Aid Building, 520 Main Street, Avon) Thursday May 30 5:00 - 7:00 pm; and Friday May 31, 6:00-8:00 pm.

Late Number & Shirt Pickup (at the pavilion on the Boardwalk at Norwood Avenue, Avon) Saturday June 1, 7:00-8:30 am. EXPECT LINES IF YOU PICK UP ON SATURDAY.  Pick up Thursday or Friday if possible, to avoid the lines.

There will be NO bib / shirt pick-up on Wednesday.

race.name: 2024 Bridgewater Donut Chase 5K
race.description:
Join us on a beautiful run in scenic Bridgewater, NJ! This 5K course gives you the best views of gorgeous Duke Island as well as the Raritan River and Canal. With half of the course adjacent to water, you are sure to have one of the most peaceful runs of your life! After completing your run, you'll end the race with a one of a kind finisher medal and a delicious donut! Whether you're a beginner running their first race or you're lacing up your running shoes for your 100th, this course is perfect for everyone. 

Are there hills? No. Whew!

Water on the course? Yes! We will have water situated around mile 1.5

Do I have to be a runner? Nope, you can absolutely walk!

Are there group/corporate discounts? Yes, please email us liverungivellc@gmail.com

 

Charity Beneficiary:

Live Run Give LLC is a race production company founded in 2019. We founded our company on the principal of bringing families and friends together for fitness and food while giving back to our community. We are committed to supporting breast cancer research and organizations that help give support to breast cancer patients. Each year, we select 2-3 not for profits to be charity beneficiaries of our races.

 

Our beneficiary for this event is : Metavivor. A portion of our proceeds and all donations will go directly to Metavivor. We picked this charity because Metavivor is at the forefront of investing in research for metastatic breast cancer, as in breast cancer that has spread to bones, brain, or other vital organs. While those men and women that die from breast cancer almost always have metastatic disease, currently only 2-5% of funds raised for breast cancer research are allocated for Stage 4. 

In honor of my best friend Lynette the matriarchs of my family Mama Ceci, Mama Olga, Mama Chicho, and my aunt Delia and the dozens of other women who inspire to give to breast cancer charities.

race.name: 2024 Bungalow Beach Boardwalk 5 Miler presented by Tito's Handmade Vodka
race.description: Join the Atlantic City Marathon Race Series with your favorite runners at the breezy beachfront bistro on Saturday, June 1. Finish at Atlantic City's Bungalow Beach to enjoy music and great food and drink in the Ibiza style beach bar. ** Less than 400 feet will be run on the sand at the finish line.

race.name: 2024 Princeton 5K
race.description:
The Princeton 5K is ready for you in 2024! In its 15th year, the Princeton 5K represents all that is good about community in-person events.  Athletes - young and old, big and small, fast and not as fast - come together year after year to run or walk while generously supporting the Princeton High School Cross Country and Track & Field teams.  

The 5K race is an IN-PERSON only event this year on Saturday, March 16.

In 2024, we are continuing to offer the KIDS DASH.  A challenging 300m loop for all children under the age of 10 years!  All participants will receive a youth t-shirt to wear with pride.  This is also an IN-PERSON event only.  

We hope to see the whole family on race day!

race.name: 2024 Run for Aaron 5K and 1Mile Walk
race.description:
Come join us for a fun and relaxed 5k run and 1Mile walk in the heart of South Jersey's farmland.  Our course winds through a rural landscape and is USATF certified (NJ0700WB).  All proceeds benefit Aaron's Fund, Inc, which supports local scholarships and charities in the Vineland area in honor of Aaron Ploch.  

-  Awards in 5K to the top 3 M/F Overall and in Age Groups: 14U, 15-19, and 10 year AG up to 70+
-  Walkers welcome, must be registered and stand behind 5K runners. Dogs welcome to walk their owners in the 1 Mile Event
* Register by April 7 to be guaranteed a race shirt*

 

Family Pricing

Register up to 5 people at a time for a flat rate of $40 for the 5K
Register up to 5 people at a time for a flat rate of $30 for the 1M

5K Team Pricing

Open to corporate and school groups, clubs, and families. Once your team reaches 3 members, the price per member is only $15 (members 1-3 will receive $5 back after member #4 registers). The largest team(s) will be recognized at the awards ceremony.

 

Powered by Second Capital Running
Entertainment provided by BME Event Group

race.name: 2024 Shamrock Shuffle B'ville
race.description:
Join us for the Fourth Annual Shamrock Shuffle in beautiful Bernardsville, NJ on Saturday March 23, 2024.  

Race day will include a USATF Grand Prix 5K on our challenging and scenic certified course, a 2 mile walk, a free kids fun run, and St. Patrick's Day festivities.  Registration is only $18 for adults and $15 for youth (14 and under).  An optional supersoft commemorative t-shirt is available as an add-on during registration.  The first 350 runners who register for the 5K will receive a festive finisher medal.

The race will be held rain or shine.

Follow us on Instagram & Facebook @shamrockbville for race photos & updates.

Paper registration available upon request.

All proceeds to benefit the School of Saint Elizabeth.

race.name: 20th Annual JSRC New Year’s Eve 2 Mile Twilight Fun Run/Walk & Party
race.description:
20th Annual JSRC New Years Eve Twilight 2-Mile Fun Run/Walk & Party
SUNDAY, DECEMBER 31 | 4:00 p.m. | Leggett’s Sand Bar, 217 First Ave., Manasquan, NJ

 

Online registration is closed. In person registration is available on Dec 31 from 2:30 pm - 3:45 pm. Limited shirts available for late registrants. 

Running In The New Year - A JSRC Tradition

Let’s face it, this is the busiest time of the year but it’s also time to think about your New Year’s Resolutions.  And with all the food and drink we are about to consume over the next few weeks, you might want to consider starting 2024 off on the right foot with some extra steps!
 
Please join us for the 20th Annual New Years Eve Twilight 2-Mile Fun Run/Walk & Party hosted by the Jersey Shore Running Club on the beautiful Manasquan beachfront. This JSRC tradition has brought smiles to the thousands who have run it in the past.  A 4:00 pm start time allows for a little “recovery time” before your late night partying. This is a SAFE and happy celebratory fun run with course marshals at selected locations. Runners, walkers and friends are all welcome!  There will be a free buffet for all participants at Leggett's Sand Bar following the run/walk.

JSRC is a 501c3 nonprofit organization.  Proceeds from the event will be donated to the Women of Irish Heritage of the Jersey Shore and VFW Post 1838 - Manasquan, NJ.  Please consider a donation to these organizations.  

VFW Post 1838 - The Manasquan VFW is considered a premier Post in New Jersey and is referred to as a model Post because of its commitment to activities. Post 1838 has 400 members that serve Manasquan, Brielle, Belmar, Sea Girt, Wall and Spring Lake Communities. It has been in charge of the annual Memorial Day Parade for many years. It also takes part in Loyalty Day programs, Veterans Day activities and special occasions where services are needed, such as Poppy distribution for Memorial Day, posting flags on Veterans gravesites and funeral services for deceased members. The Post runs the Voice of Democracy and Patriot’s Pen programs each year to help local students with scholarship money.

The Women of Irish Heritage of the Jersey Shore is a non-profit organization that promote Irish Cultural, Social and Philanthropic activities.  The funds raised contribute to education, charitable, religious or public spirited purposes to benefit an indeterminate number of persons.


                                                   REGISTRATION AND FEES

Online registration will be open through Tuesday, December 26 at jsrc.org or RunSignUp/JSRC Twilight Run or in person at Leggett’s on December 31 prior to the run/walk. No mail in entry.

Early Bird Registration (10/1 through 10/31/2023) - $30.00  (JSRC Members - $25.00)
Pre-Registration (11/1 through 12/26/2023) - $33.00
Race Day Registration (12/31/2023) - $35.00
Party Only (Includes Tee Shirt & buffet) - $20.00

                                                   RACE DAY SCHEDULE - 12/31

Bib & T-Shirt Pick Up and Post Registration at Leggett's Sand Bar - 2:30 pm - 3:45 pm
Tee Shirts for all pre-registered participants through 12/26. Tee Shirts for post registrants (12/31) only while supplies last. 
2 mile run/walk will start at 4:00 pm
Post Run/Walk Party at Leggett's Sand Bar - Free Buffet 

 

DIRECTIONS TO LEGGETT'S SAND BAR

Highway 71 to Main St, Manasquan
From North - turn left on Main St
From South - turn right onto Main St
Continue East on Main St to First Ave
Leggett's is on right Street
Parking on street and Leggett's rear parking lot

race.name: 20th Annual SGT Nutter 5K - 2024
race.description:
On Saturday, June 15, 2024, Class 67 of the New Jersey Army National Guard Officer Candidate School (NJOCS) in Sea Girt, NJ will host the 20th Annual Sergeant Nutter 5K Run. This event is organized by the SGT Sam Nutter Organization Inc (SSNO) in memory of the late SGT Samuel Nutter, to benefit the family of a NJ National Guard service member. We are asking for your help in aiding our Soldiers and their families in their time of need. The 5K race will take place at the Army National Guard Training Center in Sea Girt, New Jersey. Given the circumstances surrounding COVID-19, we will also be offering a virtual participation. On behalf of the Sergeant Samuel Nutter Organization, we encourage your support and thank you for being an invaluable part of this cause. You can support this cause by running in the race, donating, or becoming an event sponsor. Whichever you choose to do, know that you will be honoring the legacy of SGT Nutter during this year's 19th annual 5K run. SSNO is a registered 501(c) 3 non-profit organization and 100% of the proceeds will be donated.

There will be an awards ceremony at the end of the event! We will be giving out medals to the following age brackets!

race.name: 27th Annual Gloucester TWP Scholarship Run-2024
race.description:
RUN GT 5K Run/Walk - Entry Will Open in December 1, 2023.

The Gloucester Township Day Scholarship Committee invites you to run with us in the 25th Annual Gloucester Township Scholarship 5K Run and One Mile Walk on Saturday, April 13, 2024. 

Proceeds from the event fund college scholarships for high school students residing in Gloucester Township.  

The One Mile Walk/Run will begin at 8:30 am.  

The 5K Run/Walk will begin at 9:00 am. 

Runners and Walkers check in starts at 8:00 am.  

Race shirts guaranteed for the first 100 registered participants. 

Registration Fees –  5K Run/Walk- $25   One Mile Walk -$10

Late Registration – Race Day – 5K Run/Walk - $30  

Frequently Asked Questions

Where is the race taking place?
Gloucester Township Municipal Complex – 1261 Chews Landing Road, Gloucester Township, NJ 

What is the course?
5K Course starts approximately 200 yards from the Senior Center on Chews Landing Road and loops through Police patrolled streets ending in the Municipal Complex parking lot.

One Mile Walk - two loops around the Veteran’s Park track, with two small loops within the two loops.  

Is there race day registration? 
Race day registration is available from 8:00 am to 8:45 am.  

Will I receive a shirt?
Race shirts are guaranteed for the first 100 registered participants.  

How is the race timed?
Linmark Sports is a ChronoTrack authorized timing company that has timed our race for the last 23 years. 

How will I get my results?
Linmark will post results immediately as participants cross the finish line.  Results will also be available online later that day. 

What are the race categories? 
Awards will be presented to First Male Overall, First Female Overall, First Gloucester Twp. Resident Finisher, First Parent & Child Duo Finishers

Age Groups – Top 3 Males & Females - 12 & Under, 13-19,  20-29,  30-39,  40-49,  50-59,  60-69,  70+ 

Is the race children and stroller friendly?
Yes.  Those pushing strollers are asked to start in the back.  

Is race registration refundable?
Registration is non-refundable and non-transferable.  This is a rain or shine event.  

Where do I get my bib and race shirt? 
You can pick up your bib and race shirt on race day, starting at 8:00 am, in the Senior Center At The Gloucester Township Municipal Complex - 1261 Chews Landing Road, Gloucester Township, NJ

Is there food? 
We have a bountiful-race spread for our runners and walkers.

Where are your restrooms? 
We have indoor facilities!  No need to worry about smelly portable restrooms.   

Where can I find out more information about the Gloucester Township Day Scholarship Committee?
Please visit www.GTDSC.org for more information about our mission and events.  

For additional information or sponsorship opportunities, please email: Orlando Mercado, Race Director at omercado@verizon.net

race.name: 2nd Annual Shamong Turkey Trot
race.description:
Please join us for the 2nd Annual Shamong Turkey Trot 5k Run and 1 Mile Fun Run/Walk Saturday, 11/16/24 at 8:00am.  

The 5k race will be electronic chip timed with combined start and finish lines.  Finisher medals for men and women will be awarded to age-groups 14 & Under, 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, and 70+.  5k awards will be announced at 9:30am.  Live online race results.

5k registrations received before 11:59pm on 11/5/24 will include a free t-shirt.  

The 5k Run will take place 8:30am-9:30am.  The race will begin in the Indian Mills Memorial School parking lot, then turn left on Old Indian Mills Road, left on Grassy Lake, left on Stokes Road, left on Oakshade, and a left onto Old Indian Mills Road, and finish in the Indian Mills Memorial School parking lot.

5k Registration fee is $25.

All 1 Mile Fun Run/Walk participants will receive a participation award at the finish line.

The 1 Mile Fun Run/Walk will take place at 8am-8:30am on the Indian Mills Memorial School property.  

1 Mile Fun Run/Walk Registration fee is $15.

Participants are encouraged to arrive 15-20 minutes prior to their race to pick-up their bib number at the registration tent.

Sponsored by Spirit of Shamong in collaboration with Girl Scout Troop 24713.  Net proceeds will support Girl Scout take action projects in Shamong.

race.name: 3 Days at the Fair
race.description:
DAY OF REGISTRATION IS AVAILABLE WITH CASH/CHECK/ZELLE/VENMO/PAYPAL

3 Days at the Fair

144 (6Day) / 72 / 48 / 24 / 12 / 6 Hour Races plus 50K and 26.2M
at the Sussex County Fairgrounds
May 13 - 19, 2023

Course Description:
Certified NJ13501JHP, NJ13502JHP, NJ13503JHP 1.000 miles flat loop on pavement and crushed gravel (approx 5% gravel)
Course is EXACTLY a 1 mile loop, with a special start line for a Marathon or 50K finish.
Certified Marathon Course (NJ13502JHP) Boston Qualifier
Certified 50K Course (NJ13503JHP)
Certified 50 Mile Time - will be exactly 50 laps
Certified 100 Mile Time - will be exactly 100 laps

You don't run through them but the course goes in front of them
Full kitchen to provide hot and cold food at Aid Station
Access to Kitchen to cook your own food
Plenty of parking
Access to electric, 6 outlets on every pole. Bring extension cords to bring it closer to your tent.
Grassy areas for tents, close to the aid station, Start Finish area or further away for quieter nights. $25/night to be paid on-site with cash or check
Spots available for RV Parking - $50 day for full hook up to be paid on-site with cash or check

Race/Start Times

Awards for ALL races will take place at breakfast Sunday morning.

All races are finished by 9:00 am on Sunday morning.

144 Hour race begins at 9:00 am on Monday Morning

72 Hour race begins at 9:00 am on Thursday Morning (option for Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday also)

48 Hour race begins at 9:00 am on Friday Morning (option for Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday also)

Marathon or 50K can begin with 72H, 48H, 24H, 12H or 6H race and must be finished by the time the next race starts. also Mon.,Tues.,Wed. also

Runners must start at the appropriate time.  We used to allow custom starts times.  We will not be allowing this anymore. Marathon or 50K can begin with 144H, 72H, 48H, 24H, 12H or 6H race and must be finished by the time the next race starts.


RUN FOR FREE

Any runner that hits the USATF Qualifying Standards in either the 24 hour or in the 24-hour split in the 48 Hour, 72 Hour or 144 Hour events will be issued a check for the opening entry fee upon completion of the event.

Any runner looking to hit the Qualifying Standards and / or set American Records must know and follow all USATF Rules. The Rules to pay specific attention are Rules 144, 232 and 241. USATF Rule Book

A special area for these runners per Rule 241.2(e) will be near the Start / Finish.

 

ENTRY FEE SCHEDULE  We also accept checks, zelle, venmo and paypal. please email njtrailseries@gmail.com for more information

race.name: 32nd Annual River to Bay 5K
race.description:
The 2024 River to Bay 5K is scheduled as an In-Person Race on May 4 2024, rain or shine.

 

Please join us on Saturday May 4, 2024 for the 32nd Annual River to Bay 5K Classic, presented by the Kiwanis Club of Greater Toms River on its beautiful Island Heights course. This race is a USATF certified course. All participants must agree to the terms of the USATF Waiver as a condition of registration.

All proceeds benefit local youth and charitable organizations. Visit our website at http://tomsriverkiwanis.org/  and click the History tab to see some of the organizations we support.

 

Limited to the first 750 participants, please sign up early before the race fills up! Any "early bird" registrants before April 9, 2024 save $5 on registration. Early bird registrants are guaranteed a race shirt of the correct size, we cannot guarantee availability for those registering after early bird.

 

Persons, companies, or groups interested in sponsoring the 2024 race may contact alex.mizenko@gmail.com. Sponsorships range from $75 to $2,500

 

Special thanks to our platinum sponsors for this year's race, Toms River Volkswagen, as well as to major sponsors for the race, Gateway Toyota, Lakeland Bank, Vision Financial Services, and Counsellors Title Agency.

race.name: 32nd CEA/Johanna Foods Turkey Trot
race.description:
Join us THIS Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 28, 2024 for the 32nd Annual CEA/JFI Turkey Trot. The event is NJ’s original Turkey Trot and consists of a 5K Run & 2M walk that takes participants through the historic streets of Flemington, NJ.

Each year, the CEA/JFI Trot has attracted upwards of 6,000 runners & walkers who help raise funds for CEA’s employment programs that benefit hundreds of individuals with disabilities. Since 1993, we have raised much needed funds to support our mission from the generous support of our sponsors, donors, and runners. 

The CEA/JFI Turkey Trot has become a family holiday tradition for generations that offers expert and novice runners alike the opportunity to spend time with family, friends, and neighbors, to raise awareness and funding for services that help coach individuals into successful jobs in their community.

race.name: 34th Annual Pleasant Valley Twilight Challenge 5K
race.description:
The 34th Annual Pleasant Valley Twilight Challenge will be held on Sunday, June 2nd 2024 at Pleasant Valley Park in Basking Ridge, NJ! We are excited about this event and hope you'll attend and donate. This event benefits the Bernards Township Municipal Alliance Against Substance Abuse and goes towards substance misuse prevention programs in Bernards Township, NJ. Please join us!

 

Location: In beautiful Pleasant Valley Park located at 3405 Valley Road in Basking Ridge, NJ. All events take place in Parking Lot 2.

Pack Pick Up Info: Packet pick up and Same Day Registration will be from 4:00 pm - 5:30 pm on Race Day. Please park in Parking Lot 1 or 3 on Race Day.

Giveaways: Race shirts will be available to pre-registered Health Walkers and 5K Runners. Shirts will be available on Race Day while supplies last.

1 Mile Health Walk (Starts at 5:30 pm): Registration is $15. Walkers can pre-register or register on race day. The course is a scenic walk through picturesque Pleasant Valley Park! Take an invigorating walk and be back in time to cheer on 5K racers! T-shirts guaranteed for pre-registrants.

5K Race (Starts at 6 PM): Please note the change in registration fees for 2024!
Two cross country loops around the park. Early Bird Registration until March 31st is $20. Pre-registration from April 1st until May 31st is $30 (Registered online or received by May 31st). Registration is $35 on Race Day. A combination of road, trail, and grass. Aid stations are located at midpoint and finish. Chip timing, a halfway split, a finish line clock, race results, and optional text message results are provided and posted by Compuscore. T-shirts are guaranteed for pre-registrants and on race day while supplies last.

Lollipop Loop (Starts at 6:45 PM): FREE. For kids of all ages - a fun loop over a grassy field. Everyone's a winner! (Please note that this event takes place towards the end of the 5K Race)

Awards at 7:00 PM: Awards will take place at the conclusion of the 5K race. Prizes will be awarded to top overall male and female and top three runners in each age group in ten-year increments 10 and under to 80 and over. No duplicate awards will be given. 

 
Please note: No rain date or refunds.

race.name: 52nd Annual LBI Commemorative 18 Mile Run Fundraiser
race.description:
Sunday, October 8th, 2023

52 years of running on LBI!!! 

Our 52nd anniversary 18 Mile Race starts at 10:00 AM in Holgate, the 12K starts at 10:0am in Holgate.

The course is a straight, flat, point-to-point run heading North on Long Beach Blvd.

Air temperature in October on LBI is approximately 65 degrees, winds generally coming from the South.

Applications are available at the Front Desk of the Community Center and a printable version online at www.stfranciscenterlbi.org.

Registration will open up Friday April 21st both in person and online.

Final registration and race-packet pickup will be held from 2:00p to 7:00p on Saturday October 12 and from 7:00a to 9:00a on Sunday October 13. 

If possible, please register by September 15th to help us accurately order the proper amount of t-shirt sizes and medals for all of our participants. Registering early is a huge help!

The funds raised from this year’s race go directly towards improving our programs here at the St. Francis Community Center!

Looking to take part in the 18 Mile Run weekend festivities but not quite ready to take on the full 18 miles? In addition to our normally hosted 18 Mile Run, there will be a separate 12K (about 7.5 mile) fundraiser that will take place from the start line and head directly to the St. Francis Center for the finish line! This event is perfect for those interested in testing themselves at a race distance longer than a usual 5K or someone looking for a fitness walk that offers water stations and race course supervision

Entry Fees:

18 Mile Run: $80

18 Mile Run - USATF-NJ Members: $70

12K Run/Walk: $60

 Every participant will receive a race T-shirt, commemorative medal and to-go food and refreshment bag.

You Must register by  3/29 to receive a medal.

 

 

Race is produced by Even Kiel Racing.

race.name: 60th Annual Captain Zinn Memorial 5K Races
race.description:
DORBROOK PARK in Colts Neck
course map and description


PRESENTED TO YOU BY SAINT JAMES SCHOOL AND THE SHORE ATHLETIC CLUB
 
The 2024 Captain Zinn Memorial 5K Run and Racewalk will occur Sunday, April 14th at Dorbrook Park in Colts Neck, N.J. Dorbrook Park is located at 353 County Road 537 Colts Neck, N.J. Bib and T-shirt pick up will be right by the playground. 

Advance registration is 50% off for all veterans and military personnel.
All those who are eligible should contact us for a discount code.

This event honors all Vietnam Veterans and is named in memory of Captain Ronald Lloyd "Ron" Zinn, a race walker from the United States who was killed in Vietnam in 1965. He graduated from the US Military Academy in 1962 and represented the USA at both the 1960 (Rome) and 1964 (Tokyo) Summer Olympics. He placed 6th in the 20K race walk in 1964. Shore AC has held this race to remember Captain Zinn since 1966. The day features a 5K Run and Relay starting at 10:00 am and 5K Racewalk at 10:05 am, along with a kids fun run at 9:30AM. Sponsorship opportunities are also available. More details are below.
The first 200 people to register receive an event t-shirt.
New as of 2024 - current and lifetime Shore A.C. members receive a discount at registration.

 

RACE DAY INFO

9:30 AM - Kids Fun Run 
9:55 AM - National Anthem and Veterans' Recognition
10:00 AM - 5K Run & Relay Start
(2 leg relay: 1 mile & 2 mile)
10:05 AM - 5K Race Walk Start
11:00 AM Awards Ceremony 
First 200 people to register receive an event t-shirt 

AWARDS
Top 3 male and female finishers for the 5K race
Top 3 male and female finishers for the 5K racewalk
Top 3 finishers in each age group, grouped by 10 years, for the 5K race
(12 and under, 13-18, 19-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70-79, 80-89, 90 and over)
 
The Course
The 5K course includes ones smaller and one larger loop on the paced path at scenic Dorbrook Park. The races are entirely within the confines of this beautiful Monmouth County Park, and is completely closed to vehicular traffic.

race.name: 7th Annual 08085 Run/Walk/Sit
race.description:
BIB AND SHIRT PICKUP will be from 7:00 AM to 9:15 AM on RACE DAY.  Please tell the volunteers at the table your name and they will check you in.

The 8K will be 3.1 miles on paved surfaces and 1.9 miles of trail running and will start at 7:45 AM. The Kids' .8 Mile race will start at 9:00 AM. The 5K Run/Walk will be an out and back on all paved surfaces. The 5K run/walk will start at 9:20 AM. Additional race times will be added as needed to alleviate overcrowding on the course. 

8K and 5K top finishers, male and female, will each receive awards.  Age category awards will also be given.  Awards will be determined at later date. All registrants will receive a race medal. All who register before April 15 will receive a race T-Shirt. Registrants after April  will receive T-Shirts while supplies last.

See the race descriptions below. Rain or shine. 

The 08085 Run/Walk/Sit: One mild-mannered zip code … with an event boasting five fantastic options!  Join us for one or more of the 7th annual 08085 Run possibilities.  In zip code order, choose from:

1. A 0.8 Mile kids’ run/walk (1.29K) - Course along a flat, paved trail within Locke Avenue Park. 

2. A 0.8 Mile walk (VIRTUAL) - Choose your own course and walk at your leisure.

3. A 0K sit (approximately no miles) - Course along a comfortable chair of your choosing. All the stuff with little-to-none of the sweat!

4. An 8K run (4.96 miles) - Road and Trail. Mostly out-and-back course mostly along High Hill Road but only featuring gentle, rolling hills less imposing than the road’s name suggests. 3.1 Miles on the paved 5K course with another 1.9 miles on Tranquility Trails, unpaved mostly on a 20' wide dirt trail bordering wooded areas, but there are about 200 yards of trail (with tree roots) through wooded wetland areas. Depending on weather conditions, some mud may be involved.

5. A 5K run/walk (3.1 miles) - Less-challenging paved course Starting in Locke Ave Park, through High Hill Park, alongside High Hill Road to Tranquility Trails and back..

race.name: 7th Annual Om Memorial 5K Run and 1 Mile Walk
race.description:
Additional information can be found at http://www.smilesforom.org.

DATE & LOCATION

Sun May 19, 2024 7:30am
Thompson Park
Thompson Drive and Lakeview Ave, Monroe Township, NJ US 08831

Registration is now open for the Main Street Donuts Shark Run 5K! The Main Street Donuts Shark Run 5K will feature a 3.1 mile run through Matawan NJ on July 29th at 8:30 am on Main Street in Matawan. This run will pay tribute to the events of the Matawan shark attacks that took place in July 1916. The Matawan Shark attacks led to the novel and movie “Jaws”. Although tragic and terrifying for those who were victims and those involved, the events of the summer of 1916 would forever change the image of the shark worldwide. 

Runners and walkers are invited to attend and partake in the day’s activities which include a 5K run/walk and a post-race gathering with donuts, coffee, sharks and more. . A shark and donut themed medal will be given to each participant along with a delicious donut courtesy of Main Street Donuts in Matawan. 

Stroller friendly. Families and friends welcome

 The 5K is presented by Main Street Donuts and Live Run Give LLC

race.name: AAPI Montclair Color Run
race.description:
COLOR RUN 2024, SUNDAY, APRIL 28, 2024
AAPI Montclair proudly presents the third annual Color Run 2024 -- an exuberant celebration of the festivals of Holi and Songkran.
5k Race starts at 8:30 am; 1-mile Fun Run starts at 10:00 am
Brookdale Park, Montclair, NJ

ABOUT THE RACE
The Color Run 2024 is a 5k Race and 1-mile Fun Run to celebrate the Indian festival of Holi and Songkran, the Thai New Year.

This event combines two joyous festivals. Holi is popularly known as the “Festival of Colors" and the "Festival of Spring." On Holi, entire towns are bathed in vivid colors as people play Holi by splashing colored powder and water. Songkran in Thai means "to move" or "change place." Thai believe that water is purifying: it cleanses one of any bad luck from the past year, and blesses one with good fortune and happiness for the year ahead. On Songkran, people celebrate with water play.

At Color Run 2024, runners and walkers will be splashed with colored powder at various points along the route in Brookdale Park. The photo booth and color play area were so successful last year, that they will be back this year!   

There will be a detour at the finish line for participants who prefer less color. (Note: it will be difficult to completely avoid the colored powder, so please take that into consideration before registering for the race.) Strollers and wheelchairs are welcome. Children under two years old do not need to register. Race will take place rain or shine. No refunds. 

SCHEDULE
8:30 am: 5k Race starts
10:00 am: 1-mile Fun Run starts

EARLY BIRD PRICING
Early bird pricing ends March 31, 2024.

SUPPORT YOUR SCHOOL
AAPI Montclair is proud to support our local schools! 10% of race fees will be donated to local schools. Enter the codes (in capital letters) at check-out:

  • Bloomfield Educational Foundation: (BEF)
  • Clifton Education Foundation (CEF)
  • Glen Ridge Educational Foundation (GREF)
  • Livingston Education Foundation (LEF)
  • Montclair Fund for Educational Excellence (MFEE)
  • Montclair Community Pre-K (MCPK)
  • Montclair Cooperative School (MTCCOOP)
  • Montclair Kimberly Academy (MKA)
  • St. Cassian School (Cassian)
  • Verona Foundation for Educational Excellence (VFEE)

OUR MISSION
All proceeds raised will support AAPI Montclair's mission to create a more inclusive community by uplifting the varied experiences of Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders, advocating for AAPI rights and representation, and promoting awareness and education around AAPI culture and history.

For confidential fee waivers or sponsorship information, please email wendy.wong@aapimontclair.org.

race.name: Always Ready 5K
race.description:
The Cape May County Coast Guard Community Foundation will be hosting the third annual Always Ready 5K on Saturday, October 12, 2024. 

5K RUN

This landmark event flows through the scenic city of Cape May and will offer the unique opportunity to run through the U.S. Coast Guard Training Center Cape May - The Birthplace of the U.S. Coast Guard. Chip timed with instant results thanks to South Jersey Race Timing and awards to the top 3 M/f Overall and Age Groups: 14 & under, 15-19, and 10 year AG up to 60+. Race Shirts are guaranteed to those registered by September 30 (limited supply after) and all finishers receive a commemorative Always Ready Challenge Coin.

 ALWAYS READY K9 RACE

This 3K run/walk option is open to four-legged friends accompanied by 2 legged guides. Dogs must be leashed on no longer than a 6ft lead and able to maintain a calm disposition for the entirety of the event. The K9 race will start 5 minutes after the 5K. This race is brought to you by our partners at Blue Line K9.  Each finisher will receive a Blue Line K9 Champion Medal and an Always Ready K9 Bandana.

VIRTUAL 5K

Virtual 5K runners will have the entire month of October to complete their best 5K time and will receive a bib,  Always Ready T-shirt, and Challenge Coin. Virtual packets will not be mailed out until after the in-person race on 10/12.

 

COURSES

The 5K will start and finish at Harborview Park and will bring runners by Fishermans Memorial as they enter Coast Guard Training Center Cape May,  the home of the Coast Guard enlisted corps and the Coast Guard's only enlisted accession point and recruit training center. A nearly 1.5 mile tour of the base will promise plenty of monumental views running along the harbor and a glimpse of the cutters at port. Course details are subject to change. 
The K9 race will start 5 minutes after the 5K and follow the same route until runners reach the entrance to the base. K9 runners will not enter US Training Center Cape May, but will instead turnaround near the gate and return back to Harborview Park. 

 

 

ABOUT THE ORGANIZERS

Founded in 2015, the mission of the Cape May County Coast Guard Community Foundation is to nurture the relationship between Coast Guard members and their families and the people of Cape May County. We host and promote family-friendly activities throughout the year to celebrate the men and women of the United States Coast Guard serving in the South Jersey region.  Our programs honor Coast Guard men and women who serve our country and celebrate the county’s designation as a Coast Guard Community. We also support projects that enhance the morale and welfare of members of the United States Coast Guard and their families.

The foundation partners with Cape May County, its 16 municipalities and other community partners throughout the year to present activities that educate about the deep connections between the Coast Guard and the region.  Cape May County is designated as a “Coast Guard Community”, one of a select number of cities and counties in the nation.  The honor is reserved for communities that show special support and consideration for the Coast Guard and was awarded after approval by the United States Coast Guard and an act of Congress.

 

Second Capital Running produces races throughout South Jersey with the mission of cultivating strong community action and leadership through the sport of running. We are honored to work alongside the Cape May County Coast Guard Community Foundation to bring another iconic event to Cape May.
